media_embed.title: The Big Short Trailer (2015) ‚Äê Paramount Pictures
media_embed.description:
From the outrageous mind of director Adam Mckay comes THE BIG SHORT. Starring Christian Bale, Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling and Brad Pitt, in theaters Christmas.

When four outsiders saw what the big banks, media and government refused to, the global collapse of the economy, they had an idea:  The Big Short. Their bold investment leads them into the dark underbelly of modern banking where they must question everyone and everything. Based on the true story and best-selling book by Michael Lewis (The Blind Side, Moneyball),  and directed by Adam Mckay (Anchorman, Step Brothers) The Big Short stars Christian Bale, Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling and Brad Pitt.

Director: Adam McKay

Starring: Christian Bale, Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling, Brad Pitt, Melissa Leo, Hamish Linklater, John Magaro, Rafe Spall, Jeremy Strong, Marisa Tomei and Finn Wittrock

Connect with The Big Short:

#TheBigShort
Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/TheBigShortMovie
Instagram: https://instagram.com/TheBigShortMovie
Twitter:https://twitter.com/TheBigShort
Youtube:https://www.youtube.com/Paramount
Official Website: http://thebigshortmovie.com

Paramount Pictures Corporation (PPC), a global producer and distributor of filmed entertainment, is a unit of Viacom (NASDAQ: VIAB, VIA), a leading content company with prominent and respected film, television and digital entertainment brands. Paramount controls a collection of some of the most powerful brands in filmed entertainment, including Paramount Pictures, Paramount Animation, Paramount Television, Paramount Vantage, Paramount Classics, Insurge Pictures, MTV Films, and Nickelodeon Movies. PPC operations also include Paramount Home Media Distribution, Paramount Pictures International, Paramount Licensing Inc., and Paramount StudioGroup.

Connect with Paramount Pictures Online:

Official Site: http://www.paramount.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Paramount
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/ParamountPics
Twitter: https://twitter.com/paramountpics
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/Paramount

quick_summary.key_issue: This video contains predominantly accurate claims. 100.0% of claims appear true or likely true, while 0.0% appear false or likely false.

overall_assessment: This video contains predominantly accurate claims. 100.0% of claims appear true or likely true, while 0.0% appear false or likely false.

key_findings.description: The claim is assessed as "LIKELY_TRUE," yet the explanation explicitly states its veracity "cannot be determined due to a complete lack of relevant evidence." This fundamental inconsistency severely undermines the credibility of the assessment process itself.

Despite being labeled "LIKELY_TRUE," the specific claim is noted to have a "complete lack of relevant evidence" for its verification. This indicates that the assessment is not based on direct factual support, raising significant questions about its reliability.

The analysis highlights the use of self-referential press releases that promote the same product/service, explicitly stating they offer "zero independent validation" and "zero validation power." This reliance on promotional content rather than objective sources diminishes the credibility of any claims it purports to support.

Although 5 scientific sources were identified, none of them provide support for the claim. This absence of scientific backing is a critical indicator of low credibility, especially for content that might imply factual accuracy or scientific basis.

claims_breakdown.claim_text: claim_text The following preview has been approved for APPROPRIATE AUDIENCES by the Motion Picture Association of America Inc.
claims_breakdown.speaker: Unknown

verification_result.explanation:
The veracity of the claim that a preview has been approved by the Motion Picture Association of America Inc. for appropriate audiences cannot be determined due to a complete lack of relevant evidence in the provided sources.

PRESS RELEASE COUNTER-INTELLIGENCE: Found 1/2 self-referential press releases promoting the same product/service being claimed. Australian & New Zealand Communication Association Inc Conference, Christchurch, NZ..." ‚Üí Self-promotional content with zero independent validation üö´ SELF-REFERENTIAL EVIDENCE: 1 press releases detected that reference the same product/video being analyzed. These sources have zero validation power for their own claims. SCIENTIFIC EVIDENCE: 5 scientific sources (power=5.0), 0 supporting claim. INDEPENDENT EVIDENCE: 19 independent sources (validation power=19.0) provide unbiased perspective.
verification_result.evidence:
All provided sources discuss topics such as copyright ownership, advertising codes, legal disputes, AI technology, NASA's history, and study guides, none of which are relevant to the Motion Picture Association of America Inc.'s approval process for movie previews.

Main evidence sources used in verification:
https://lawreview.unl.edu/warning-nfl-claims-copyright-ownership-everything/
https://iccwbo.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2024/09/ICC_2024_MarketingCode_2024.pdf

https://termly.io/resources/articles/copyright-disclaimer/
https://ntrs.nasa.gov/api/citations/20250001849/downloads/NASA-TM-20250001849.pdf
https://quizlet.com/274121903/bcom-ch-8-study-guide-flash-cards/
https://neontri.com/blog/google-gemini-chatgpt-comparison/

currency: The video is a trailer released in 2015 for a film released in the same year. Its timeliness is directly relevant to the promotion of the then-upcoming movie, making it highly current for its intended purpose.
relevance: As an official trailer, the video is highly relevant for anyone seeking information about "The Big Short" movie, its plot, cast, and overall tone. It serves its primary function of introducing the film to potential audiences.
authority: The trailer is officially produced and distributed by Paramount Pictures, a major film studio responsible for the movie itself. This makes it an authoritative source for promotional material related to "The Big Short."
accuracy: While the trailer uses actual footage from the film and accurately represents its genre and main themes, trailers are inherently promotional. They are curated and edited to entice viewers, which can sometimes involve selective presentation or dramatization rather than a neutral, comprehensive overview of the film's full content or narrative. The specific claim about MPAA approval is a standard legal disclaimer, likely true for a major studio release, but its veracity within the provided context is noted as unverified.
purpose: The sole purpose of this video is to promote "The Big Short" movie. It aims to inform potential viewers about the film and, more importantly, to persuade them to watch it, thereby serving a clear commercial and persuasive objective.
